summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from June-July 2020 regarding a request for assistance with a 'taint review' in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show FBI agents in New York and another office (TD) coordinating volunteer help for this high-profile investigation.

persons.name: M, I. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Appears to be the primary case agent or coordinator for the Epstein case taint review, sending and receiving emails to organize volunteer assistance from other FBI personnel.

persons.name: (TD) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI agent from another office (likely a field office designated 'TD') who volunteers to assist with the Epstein case taint review and coordinates logistics for accessing systems and training.

persons.name: M, M. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI agent in New York copied on the initial request for taint review assistance, part of the internal coordination.

persons.name: E. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Recipient of the initial email from SA M, I. (NY) (FBI) requesting help with the Epstein case taint review.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the high-profile investigation for which the FBI is conducting a taint review.

connections.description: Coordinating volunteer assistance for the Epstein case taint review, with (TD) (FBI) offering help and M, I. (NY) (FBI) managing access and onboarding.
M, I. (NY) (FBI) reaches out to E. (NY) (FBI) to request assistance with the Epstein case taint review.
M, I. (NY) (FBI) is the case agent or coordinator for the taint review related to the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Initial Taint Review Request
events.description: SA M, I. (NY) (FBI) sends an email to SA E. (NY) (FBI) requesting assistance with a taint review for the Epstein case.

events.title: Formal Assistance Request Circulated
events.description: A formal request for volunteer assistance for the Epstein case taint review is circulated among FBI personnel, describing it as a 'unique opportunity to work on a high profile investigation.'

events.title: Planned In-Person Coordination
events.description: (TD) (FBI) plans to be at '26 fed' (likely 26 Federal Plaza, NYC FBI office) for training and to meet with M, I. (NY) (FBI) for an overview of the taint review.

locations: 26 fed (likely 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY - FBI New York Field Office)
9th floor (likely of the FBI New York Field Office)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking volunteer assistance for a 'taint review' related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation as of June-July 2020.
The taint review was described as a 'unique opportunity to work on a high profile investigation,' indicating its significance within the FBI.
The coordination involved setting up a 'CAIR account' and access 'on the high side,' suggesting the review involved classified or sensitive systems.
The primary case agent for this aspect of the Epstein investigation is SA M, I. (NY) (FBI) from the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad in New York.
The emails show internal FBI procedural steps for onboarding additional personnel onto a sensitive case.
